item_prompt: I have found my work to be meaningful.
I have felt inspired by my work.
I have felt a sense of purpose at work.
I have felt fully immersed in my work.
I have enjoyed my work.
I have felt motivated to do my best at work.
I have felt burned out by my work.
I have felt emotionally drained by my work.
I have dreaded going to work.
I have struggled to cope with stress.
I have gotten angry over small inconveniences.
I have felt irritable.
Throughout the day I can stay focused on what I want to accomplish without getting distracted.
It is easy for me to focus my attention on one thing for long periods of time.
When I get distracted it is easy for me to refocus my attention.
I often “get lost” in my work.
I often find myself completely absorbed in my work.
When I am working intensely I lose track of time.
I always act in accordance with my values.
My values are very important to me.
I have a clear understanding of my core values.
I often find myself thinking about something other than what is happening right in front of me.
I often get distracted thinking about past or future events.
I find myself going through my day on autopilot.
It is easy for me to control my emotions.
It is unusual for me to let my emotions get the best of me.
I never let my emotions control my behavior.
It is easy for me to get back on track when something goes wrong.
I recover quickly after stressful experiences.
It is easy for me to cope with setbacks.
I like activities that stretch what I am capable of.
I enjoy challenging projects.
I enjoy taking on projects that allow me to learn something new.
I can achieve anything that I set my mind to.
I believe I can achieve the things that I want in life.
I believe that I have complete control over my own life.
I believe it is better to try and fail than to not try at all.
I expect to make mistakes when I am trying something new
I believe that growth requires taking risks that may result in failure.
I make sure team members are able to openly discuss problems and tough issues.
During team discussions, I make sure others feel comfortable giving me feedback.
I encourage members of my team to ask for my help when they need it.
During team discussions, I encourage others to share their ideas.
I encourage team members who do not often speak up to participate in discussions.
I make sure that all team members are involved in important discussions that impact them.
I have high quality relationships with my coworkers.
I get to know my coworkers on a personal level.
I have a high level of trust with my coworkers.
I make efforts to cultivate trust amongst my team members.
My coworkers feel comfortable bringing problems to me when they arise.
I make efforts to ensure that there is not an "in-group" and an "out-group" on my team.
I express energy/passion at work so that it spreads throughout our team.
I inspire my coworkers to think about their work in new and exciting ways.
I communicate my vision for the future to my coworkers.
I have open conversations with my team members about how they can be more effective in their role.
I help coworkers think through their long-term career goals.
I suggest opportunities to my coworkers that will help them grow and develop.
I acknowledge individuals on my team when they produce high quality work.
I acknowledge my team collectively when we produce high quality work.
When a coworker works particularly hard, I make a point of acknowledging their extra effort.
I allow my team members to decide the best way to complete their job tasks.
I give my coworkers the autonomy to make important decisions on their own.
I help my coworkers feel ownership over the work they do.
I make sure that everyone on my team has a clear understanding of their responsibilities.
I make sure that my coworkers have everything they need to be successful.
I make sure my coworkers have a clear understanding of what we are trying to achieve.
I am good at finding creative ways to help my team solve problems.
I regularly have open discussions with my coworkers about how we can solve problems most effectively.
I am good at working with coworkers to develop successful strategies.
I provide feedback to coworkers that helps them perform tasks more effectively.
I let my team members know what they are doing well so they can continue to build on their strengths.
I provide feedback on what coworkers can do better in the future, rather than pointing out their mistakes.
I use logic, rather than just my opinion, to convince others of my ideas.
To persuade others, I explain how my proposed ideas align with team goals.
I ask others for their input to get them onboard with new ideas.
